channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anti-Immigrant Rioting Stretches Into Second Night in Northern Ireland
item.description: Homes, businesses and cars were attacked and 17 police officers were injured during violence in Ballymena and several other areas.

item.title: How Keurig Dr Pepper CEO Tim Cofer secured one of the biggest coups of his career, a $1.65 billion deal for an energy drink giant
item.description: Cofer had his eye on GHOST—but had to convince co-founder Dan Lourenco to sell.

item.title: Google is offering buyouts and tightening its RTO policy—only problem is, it’s already worried about losing top performers
item.description: Google announced a 'voluntary exit program' for more of its teams, offering payouts irrespective of role or level, and regardless of if the decision i...

item.title: Rubio Is Pressing to Open Sanctions Investigation Into Harvard
item.description: Experts and former officials said it was unusual for a cabinet secretary to try to influence the Treasury Department’s sanctions process to target a d...

item.title: How overconfidence can kill a COO’s shot at the corner office
item.description: For ambitious COOs, the lesson is clear: respect the current power structure, and stay tightly synced with the CEO.

item.title: Germany Embraces LNG as It Weans Itself Off Russian Gas
item.description: The country, like others across Europe, is building more facilities to handle an increase in imports of liquefied natural gas, much of it from the Uni...

item.title: Exclusive: Outdoor Voices founder Ty Haney raises $11 million for her second startup
item.description: Haney founded TYB, a consumer loyalty platform for brands like Glossier and Poppi, a little over three years ago.

item.title: Trump is Pushing Allies Away and Closer Into Each Other’s Arms
item.description: Important U.S. allies are trying to bolster their ties as the Trump administration shifts priorities and reshapes the world order.

item.title: Databricks CEO met his founding team during college—he tells Gen Z not to give up on higher education even if employers have
item.description: Forget dropping out: These founders say college connections were key to building a $62 billion company

item.title: Amid Russian Strikes, a Remote Corner of Ukraine Beckons

item.title: Disney and Universal Sue A.I. Firm Midjourney for Copyright Infringement
item.description: The suit, against Midjourney, is the first time major Hollywood companies have sued over A.I.-generated images.
